Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the photograph in the Facebook post does not show the damage done to the Abaco Islands by Hurricane Dorian, but rather shows the damage caused by Hurricane Michael in Mexico Beach, Florida.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent of the damage done to the Abaco Islands by Hurricane Dorian by using a photograph from a different hurricane in a different location.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the statement that the Facebook post was widely shared or that it includes a photograph of damage to the Abaco Islands.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Facebook post was made in a sincere attempt to galvanize public solidarity with the inhabitants of the Bahamas, without providing any evidence or supporting information.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim raises the possibility that the Facebook post may have had alternative motives or intentions, without providing any evidence or further explanation.
